Anaemia 
• All pregnant women should have a haemoglobin (Hb) measurement at the first antenatal visit, and if ≥10g/dL it
should be repeated around 30 weeks and again at 38 weeks.
• Any Hb level of <10 g/dL should be followed up with more frequent Hb measurements after initiating treatment.
A haemoglobin meter should be used if available, so that the result is available at the same visit.
